sub_concepts.name: Superstrings
sub_concepts.definition: One-dimensional strings that are the fundamental objects in string theory.

sub_concepts.name: D-branes
sub_concepts.definition: Higher-dimensional objects that endow string theory with supersymmetry and provide a framework for understanding the behavior of strings at low energies.

sub_concepts.name: Calabi-Yau manifolds
sub_concepts.definition: Complex geometric structures that play a central role in compactifying spacetime dimensions in string theory.

sub_concepts.name: Gravitons
sub_concepts.definition: Hypothetical particles thought to mediate the force of gravity, which are predicted by some versions of string theory.

sub_concepts.name: Branes
sub_concepts.definition: Higher-dimensional generalizations of D-branes that can interact with each other and give rise to new phenomena such as brane cosmology.

sub_concepts.name: String dualities
sub_concepts.definition: Equivalences between different string theories that reveal hidden symmetries and provide insights into the structure of the universe.
